job_description: Sr Data Analyst, AMERICAS - job post Smart AdServer 12 reviews Manhattan, NY 10001 • Temporarily remote $95,000 - $115,000 a year -  Full-time Smart AdServer 12 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $95,000 - $115,000 a year Job Type Full-time Hi! We are Smart! * Smart is an AdTech leader created in 2001 on the belief that we can disrupt the on-line advertising industry. * * Headquartered in the heart of Paris and with offices in 12 countries, Smart provides cutting-edge technologies that help hundreds of prestigious customers take back control and maximize their digital revenues with a flexible and transparent audience monetization platform. * * We can rely on a unique group of 280+ Smarties focused on excellence to shape our future. They continually embrace change and overcome challenges together to make innovation happen. That means we can offer you endless opportunities to do the same and let you shape the world you want! * * About the team Helping the company be fully data-driven is not just a buzzword, it is our mission at Smart. We, the Data Analytics team at Smart, maximize Smart’s efficiency by enabling easy and permanent access to quality data, valuable insights & rigorous thinking. Our responsibility is to ensure our local and central teams, clients and partners, make informed business decisions. To do so, we leverage huge volumes of data (Smart handles 30Bn Auctions per Day) in a state-of-the-art tech stack (AirFlow, Snowflake, Tableau…) in order to provide actionable insights to all teams at Smart! What you'll do Reporting to the Head of Analytics Operations, your mission will be to provide hands-on analytical support to the Supply, Demand & PR teams based in the Americas (US, Mexico, Brazil). Get an in-depth understanding of the revenue dynamics of the Publishers & Buyers managed in the Americas to be able to quickly identify the main performance drivers. Investigate our clients’ performances in depth in order to provide actionable recommendations to optimize the setup of our publisher, the buying strategy of our partners, and ultimately Smart’s revenues. Drive coordination and push for the adoption of the best practices shared with the teams in order to maximize revenue. Collaborate with the Central Analytics team to ensure that the teams in the Americas have all the resources they need. Partner with the business teams to properly answer RFPs & RFIs from our Partners. Share valuable insights with our PR team for external communication (barometers, benchmarks…) About you Bachelor or Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative or business field (Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Economics, Finance, etc.) Min. 2 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Business Analyst position. Knowledge of SQL is a must. Basic knowledge of reporting software (Tableau). You can demonstrate your ability to solve problems end to end, and you’re able to present results to both technical and non-technical audiences You are action-oriented and know how to drive adoption of best practices through the company. Smart AdServer is an equal opportunity employer. Equal access to employment, services, and programs are available to everyone, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. * Job Type: Full-time Pay: $95,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental pay types: Bonus pay Work Location: One location Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Title: Data Analyst Reports to: VP Operations POSITION SUMMARY The Data Analyst is responsible for answering the business’ relevant questions through data by understanding how we store, examine and utilize data within the organization. This person will enter data into a well-designed database and interact with it using SQL for scalability and automation. Exploring different ways to analyze, manipulate, integrate and extract insights from data will be a key function in this role. Key Duties and Responsibilities: Create and maintain complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data. Design and implement efficient data storage solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements. Build and maintain SQL-based reports to support business decisions. Join data from multiple databases and tables to create comprehensive reports. Continuously monitor and optimize query performance. Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders. Other additional and/or alternative duties as assigned. Required Skills/Abilities: Significant experience in SQL language and data management. Strong understanding of SQL query optimization and performance tuning. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or related discipline. Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus. Thrives in a fast paced environment. 2-4 years of prior experience. Experience with data visualization and reporting tools. About Us: Wonder Meats Inc. has been family owned and operated since 1971. Since then, we’ve honed our craft to become a leading manufacturer of quality meat products. We are now on our third generation of leadership and continue to operate based on the same core values of our founder – Quality, Consistency, and Dedication. Ready to join the team? Contact us now! Senior Data Analyst - job post Physician's Weekly 6 reviews Basking Ridge, NJ 07920 • Hybrid remote $75,000 - $90,000 a year -  Full-time Physician's Weekly 6 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $75,000 - $90,000 a year Job Type Full-time Senior Data Analyst Physician’s Weekly, a leading medical news service and custom healthcare publishing company for doctors and their staff, is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Basking Ridge, NJ based data team. In this critical position, the Senior Data Analyst will handle post-sale fulfilment both for our print and digital contracts. We are looking for a competent individual who can coordinate with multiple teams to manage our print inventory to accurately allocate available inventory for signed contracts and report the remaining availability. In addition, you must prepare the email lists necessary to fulfill contracts related to our client’s email campaigns. Your job is important since the efficient handling of the company’s products and services is critical for the attainment of business goals. The role requires a technically savvy individual who is curious about the larger strategic picture and who thinks creatively on how best to answer critical business questions with the data available. This is a high-paced role and requires the ability to stay focused while handling multiple projects under tight deadlines. Essential Functions Gather data from various data sets using Alteryx and other ETL tools. Manage print inventory availability for all clients by locking in print wallboard locations per contract as they come in, then reporting the updated inventory numbers. Author reports on our sold vs unsold wallboard locations on a rolling basis to provide insights on current and projected trends to be shared with upper management. Generate email lists for upcoming client digital campaigns and apply analytics capabilities to monitor their behavior to determine user habits across our digital platforms. Adapt and improve inventory management processes as necessary. Use tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats such as spreadsheets and Power BI. Communicate with stakeholders to understand data content and prioritize business requirements. Autonomy to operate with a limited level of direct supervision by showcasing the ability to exercise independent judgment. Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in data related field of study or 5+ years’ experience in data analytics intensive role. Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a data analytics function with core daily responsibilities in with databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, MS Access, etc. Strong SQL skills are required, including an ability to write and troubleshoot SQL queries from scratch. Knowledge of relevant relational databases & understanding of data sources, data organization and storage. Minimum 2-3 years’ experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik Sense. Highly analytical with ability to extract and analyze large amounts of data and draw actionable insights and recommendations. Ability to synthesize complicated data into actionable messages for those who are ‘not technical’. Strong analytical skills and basic knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques. Exposure to data manipulation using Alteryx or other ETL tools a plus. Experience with Python or other programming languages a plus Understanding of the healthcare industry and physician databases is ideal. Attention to detail and ownership of tasks. Strong interpersonal skills and clear verbal and written communication skills. Critical thinking and time management skills a must. Interested? Please email jobs@physweekly.com, attaching a current resume and a cover letter explaining why you would be a good fit for the job. Please include the title of the position being applied for and your desired salary requirements. Learn more about Physician’s Weekly by visiting us at www.physiciansweekly.com . Data Analyst - job post Queens Public Library 114 reviews Jamaica, NY 11432 • Hybrid remote $48,000 - $64,000 a year -  Full-time Queens Public Library 114 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $48,000 - $64,000 a year Job Type Full-time DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Reporting to the Senior Manager of Organizational Assessment, the Data Analyst is responsible for data collection, formatting, analysis, and visualization of library services, programs, and community-level data. This position will contribute to Queens Public Library’s (QPL) culture of data-driven planning and decision-making. The Data Analyst will assist in the creation of data presentations, reports, dashboards, and maps that effectively communicate findings from analyses. Collects, formats, and analyzes library service metrics, programs data, and community-level data to identify trends, correlations, and actionable insights that are useful for planning and delivering programs and services. Documents and tracks data on factors impacting trends in library service metrics. Responds to internal and external requests for data and special reports related to Library operations and demographically targeted services as needed. Identifies publicly available datasets (i.e. Census, NYC Open Data) applicable to program planning and improvement of library services. Collects, analyzes, and correlates census data and other publicly available datasets relevant to QPL’s library service areas and communities. Identifies and implements process improvements, resulting in more efficient data collection, reporting, and analysis workflows (i.e. code script development, automation of data collection and formatting, etc.). Supports and project manages initiatives to collect, report, and manage internal performance metrics. Conducts predictive analytics, establishes benchmarks for service metrics for each branch, and contributes to ongoing performance management. Collects, prepares, and submits Federal, State, and Local reports as needed/required. Assists in compiling monthly reports and data summaries to senior leadership. Consolidates and organizes data documents, definitions, spreadsheets, and code scripts into GitHub and/or other centralized, accessible folders. Assists in development of surveys, evaluation frameworks, logic models, and performance metrics pertaining to QPL’s programs. Analyzes survey findings and summarizes key takeaways. Conducts literature reviews and summaries of best practices, synthesizing best practices at other library systems to consider for adoption at QPL. Creates, enhances, and maintains existing platforms related to data collection, storage, maintenance, and visualization (i.e. dashboards, community partner database, etc.). Attends webinars on relevant subject content (data analysis, implementing equity principles in data collection, etc.) and summarize key takeaways. Assists in identification and implementation of technological platforms that facilitate data streamlining, accessibility, and visualization. Assists in the provision of regular updates on data to staff; participates in meetings with other library systems and key stakeholders and records meeting notes and next steps. Visualizes data in BI dashboard reports and maps and summarizes key takeaways from data analyses. Assists in expanding staff capacity to easily access and use dashboards and maps. Develops data dictionaries, standard operating procedures, user guides, manuals, and training webinars that provide guidance to staff on use of dashboards, map webapps, databases, and other data visualization tools. Assists in development of PPT presentations and reports that succinctly communicate and summarize trends and patterns of data pertaining to library services, survey findings, Census data, publicly available datasets (NYC Open data), and program evaluations. Fulfills other related data, assessment, and evaluation requests from staff (as needed). Performs other duties as assigned. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: · Bachelor’s Degree required. · A minimum of 3 years of experience data collection, data wrangling, data analysis, reporting, and visualization. · Experience using statistical software packages (R, Python, etc.) to collect, format, and analyze data. · Experience working with Census data (American Community Survey, PUMS, decennial, etc.); knowledge of incorporating publicly available community-level datasets (NYC Open Data) into analyses. · Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and Google Suite platforms (Docs, Slides, Sheets, etc.) required. · Familiarity with an enterprise Business Intelligence tool (e.g., Power BI, Google Data Studio, Tableau, etc.). · Familiarity with survey tools, such as SurveyMonkey and Google Forms. · Familiarity with mapping platforms (ArcGIS, QGIS, Mapbox, Carto, etc.). · Familiarity with CRM database platforms. ABOUT QUEENS PUBLIC LIBRARY: Queens Public Library is a national and international leader in the delivery of public library service. Our mission is to transform lives by cultivating personal and intellectual growth and by building strong communities. Queens Public Library welcomes innovators and leaders to contribute to a long history and dynamic future of serving the most diverse county in the United States. Queens Public Library is a private, non-profit corporation with 1,700 employees serving 65 locations. portfolio of relevant work appreciated You are SQL proficient, with a comfortability navigating relational databases You have expertise with at least one BI tool such as Tableau, Looker, or similar Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources You enjoy being an independent operator who can employ critical thinking and problem solving, but knows how to use the resources at their disposal to get the job done You are relentlessly curious about what insights exist within large data sets, and the ability to communicate those insight to a non-technical audience We’d love it if you also had: College Degree preferred A passion for music, with a working knowledge of the current consumption landscape Experience working in the music distribution space Experience working with Data Science frameworks Working knowledge of Python and/or R a big plus About us: As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible. At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons. Job Description Summary of Duties and Responsibilities: The Data Analyst supports data analysis and usage requirements and focuses on data and integration intensive initiatives working with all teams within Data and Analytics. Primary responsibilities include working with understanding data analysis and integration requirements and supporting the solution design and architecture of data platform capabilities (EDW, Data Marts, Data Sharing Repositories, Materialized Views etc.) to meet these needs. The Data Analyst will work closely with the Analytics Centers of Excellence Core leaders, members of the Enterprise Information Management teams, and Applications teams to build and support the strategic approaches and methods to a variety of analyses. General tasks and responsibilities will include: Work within Service Delivery teams to understand analytics requirements for data Support solution design to meet data acquisition, integration and provisioning requirements and envision future use cases for the enterprise data platform. Identify new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value. Coordinate with data owners to ensure data accessibility and quality and contribute to management of central data stores and metadata. Preparing forecasts and analyzes data trends, identify data anomalies and conduct deep dive data analysis. Carefully analyze the data and draw conclusions, communicating the results in a clear, concise and actionable manner Collate, Cleanse and Organize data from several sources and work with cross‐functional project teams that include Business Analysts, Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Data Quality Assurance, and Data visualization Communicate directly with team members/support team to diagnose and resolve data platform issues. Work with other team members to continually improve our delivery and processes. Create and maintain documentation of data procedures, policies, and adaptation. Minimum Qualifications 1. A Masters Degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and two years of experience serving as a lead in soliciting, defining, and managing requirements for internally and externally developed software in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or 2. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university and five years of experience as described above; or 3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience. 4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one year. Department Preferences Popular data discovery, analytics and BI software tools like [Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI and others] for semantic-layer-based data discovery Data analysis, data discovery, data exploration, data profiling methods used to support development of data warehouses, data marts, data lakes 1+ years of experience working with Snowflake 1+ years of experience working with Data Integration software such as Informatica PowerCenter, or IBM DataStage Experience in Data Warehousing roles or functions such as quality assurance/testing, development, enterprise architecture, or project management. Experience working on a project using Agile Experience with advanced analytics tools for Object-oriented/object function scripting using languages such as R, Python, Java, C++, Scala, others 5+ years of experience with popular database programming languages including SQL, PL/SQL (required), others for relational databases and certifications on upcoming NoSQL/Hadoop oriented databases (preferred) like MongoDB, Cassandra, others for nonrelational databases. 5+ years of experience working with healthcare data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions. 2+ years of experience supporting production data engineering and production data products (data warehouses, data marts, data hubs, data lakes) How To Apply Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire. NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes: Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week Retirement Savings and Pension Plans Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities Multiple employee discounts programs Job Type: Full-time Pay: $78,681.00 - $115,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: New York, NY: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

In this role, you'll be responsible for creating data analyses that demonstrate our company's impact to clients and strategic partners.The Clinical Data Analyst II is responsible for supporting the development and execution of analytics, providing data-driven strategic insights, and creating customized analytic approaches in a pharmacy benefits setting. The role supports Rightway's PBM management, operations, and other internal departments. The Clinical Data Analyst II will develop and deliver complex analytical needs, including analyzing and modeling for quarterly performance reviews, and for ad hoc client inquiries. To be successful in this role, you'll need a bachelor's degree in a relevant field and 3+ years of experience in quantitative analytics, conducting advanced analytic modeling for large claims databases. You should also have 3+ years of experience querying and analyzing pharmacy claims data and experience gathering and documenting requirements from clients or the business. You will need to be proficient with SQL and have experience with process improvement, workflow, and benchmarking. If you are a highly skilled Clinical Data Analyst with a passion for providing data-driven strategic insights and creating custom analytic approaches, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and provide clear direction on how to be successful in your work. WHAT YOU'LL DO Providing superior analytic modeling with a focus on client satisfaction, retention, and trend management Supporting short and long term operational and strategic business activities Identifying and analyzing opportunities to manage trend and improve our company's services Designing, executing, and maintaining advanced PBM analytics, conducting and evaluating trend analyses Efficiently extracting and manipulating pharmacy claim data for internal and external clients Using your analytic skills to perform client-specific analyses in response to business questions and communicate the findings, including data sources, methodology, outcomes, and recommendations Communicating drug cost, utilization, and trend information to requesters and responding to plan-specific analytic inquiries Presenting clinical and financial findings based on analytic insights to internal or external partners Developing, enhancing, and maintaining operational information and models that will have an impact on business execution Demonstrating a high achievement drive and delivering superior performance Generating innovative ideas that can be scaled across the organization Routinely identifying, developing, and sharing best practice experience with peers Routinely collaborating with clinical consulting and account management to provide clinical aspects of client quarterly reviews WHO YOU ARE: Intermediate level of proficiency with SQL Proficiency with relational databases, database structures 3+ years of experience in quantitative analytics and conducting advanced analytic modeling for large claims databases 3+ years of industry experience querying and analyzing pharmacy claims data Experience gathering and documenting requirements from the client/business Ability to communicate analysis to business partners and clients in writing and verbally Excellent communication and interpersonal skills EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 3+ years of managed care or PBM experience Bachelor's degree in analytics, CS or related field or equivalent work experience Advanced level of proficiency with at least one data query and analysis tools (SQL, SAS, Python) AWS experience, Glue or Redshift is a big plus Proven experience with version control, engineering SDLC, coding standards SALARY RANGE: $100k-$130k ABOUT RIGHTWAY: Rightway is on a mission to harmonize healthcare for everyone, everywhere. Our products guide patients to the best care and medications by inserting clinicians and pharmacists into a patient's care journey through a modern, mobile app. Rightway is a front door to healthcare, giving patients the tools they need along with on-demand access to Rightway health guides, human experts that answer their questions and manage the frustrating parts of healthcare for them. Since its founding in 2017, Rightway has raised over $130mm from investors including Khosla Ventures, Thrive Capital, and Tiger Global at a valuation of $1 billion. We're headquartered in New York City, with a satellite office in Denver. Our clients rely on us to transform the healthcare experience, improve outcomes for their teams, and decrease their healthcare costs. HOW WE LIVE OUR VALUES TO OUR TEAMMATES: We're seeking those with passion for healthcare and relentless devotion to our goal. We need team members that embody our following core values: 1) We are human, first Our humanity binds us together. We bring the same empathetic approach to every individual we engage with, whether it be our members, our clients, or each other. We are all worthy of respect and understanding and we engage in our interactions with care and intention. We honor our stories. We listen to—and hear—each other, we celebrate our differences and similarities, we are present for each other, and we strive for mutual understanding. 2) We redefine what is possible We always look beyond the obstacles in front of us to imagine new solutions. We approach our work with inspiration from other industries, other leaders, and other challenges. We use ingenuity and resourcefulness when faced with tough problems. 3) We debate then commit We believe that a spirit of open discourse is part of a healthy culture. We understand and appreciate different perspectives and we challenge our assumptions. When working toward a decision or a new solution, we actively listen to one another, approach it with a "yes, and" mentality, and assume positive intent. Once a decision is made, we align and champion it as one team. 4) We cultivate grit Changing healthcare doesn't happen overnight. We reflect and learn from challenges and approach the future with a determination to strive for better. In the face of daunting situations, we value persistence. We embrace failure as a stepping stone to future success. On this journey, we seek to act with guts, resilience, initiative, and tenacity. 5) We seek to delight Healthcare is complicated and personal. We work tirelessly to meet the goals of our clients while also delivering the best experience to our members. We recognize that no matter the role or team, we each play a crucial part in our members' care and take that responsibility seriously. When faced with an obstacle, we are kind, respectful, and solution-oriented in our approach. We hold ourselves accountable to our clients and our members' success. Rightway is a healthcare company looking to improve healthcare outcomes for everyone, everywhere. With that in mind, we have to consider what is good for the health of our team, the company, and the communities we operate in. As such, Rightway has determined a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees , in combination with other safety precautions, is the best way forward.
